lines.text:
[Trying to convince Gallagher that their visitor was a fake]
All you have to do is to look at his picture in the file, sir.
Never mind the file. Now let me get this straight. You say the whole world thinks that the man who inspected our plant yesterday was the president of the Consolidated Motors, is that it?
Yes, sir. Then he made a speech at the Chamber of Commerce.

Mr. McKinley thinks he is the president of the Consolidated Motors, the papers think so, the Chamber of Commerce thinks so, but you don't. You think he is a measly little printer in our hand-press department.
I am sorry if you refuse to believe me, Mr. Gallagher.

[sarcastically]
Aw, don't be silly Erickson. Of course I believe you. And by the way, my name isn't Gallagher. I am Harry Truman, President of the United States. And you are not Erickson. You're Princess Elizabeth's baby, bonny Prince Charley, remember?
